name: gemini-browser-agent
description: A browser agent with a Google Chrome extension that can work in your browser. Based on Google Gemini 2.5 computer use model.
readme_summary: Gemini Browser Agent is a research project that enables Google Gemini's computer use model to automate tasks directly within a user's Chrome browser. It connects a Chrome extension with the Gemini API, allowing it to observe the active tab, interact with web content, and perform actions without requiring a sandbox.
key_features: Browser automation agent
Chrome extension integration
Utilizes Google Gemini 2.5 computer use model
Observes active tab, exchanges screenshots and events
Performs actions directly in the user's browser
No sandbox or virtual machine required
Python WebSocket bridge for communication
primary_use_case: Automating tasks and interactions within a user's web browser using the Google Gemini AI model.
cover_image_prompt: A digital assistant, depicted as a friendly robot with a glowing screen for a face, is actively navigating a stylized, transparent browser window. The robot is shown reaching out with a digital hand, manipulating elements like buttons and forms within the browser. Streams of data, represented by glowing lines and code snippets, flow from the robot's core to the browser interface, illustrating its control. Subtle UI elements of the Gemini Browser Agent extension are visible in a corner of the scene. The background is a clean, abstract digital space with soft, ambient lighting, emphasizing the focus on the browser interaction. The overall style is a vibrant 3D isometric illustration, conveying innovation and seamless integration.

name: firefox-one
description: Firefox Theme for Opera One skin Lovers
readme_summary: This repository provides a custom CSS theme for the Firefox browser, designed to emulate the visual style of the Opera One browser skin. It allows users to personalize their Firefox interface with a distinct aesthetic, offering various color options and adaptive themes.
key_features: Opera One skin emulation for Firefox
Multiple color themes available
Light/dark adaptive theme support
Customizable user interface elements
Installation instructions via profile directory modification
primary_use_case: To customize the visual appearance of the Firefox browser to resemble the Opera One browser skin.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized illustration of a Firefox browser window seamlessly transforming into an Opera One browser window. Imagine a digital chameleon, with the Firefox logo on one side and the Opera One logo on the other, its body a blend of both browser interfaces. The transformation should be visually striking, with flowing lines of CSS code acting as the connecting element. Subtle UI elements from both browsers should be visible, highlighting the aesthetic merge. The background should be clean and modern, perhaps with abstract digital patterns. The overall mood should be one of stylish customization and user interface evolution. The style should be a clean, 3D isometric illustration with vibrant, contrasting colors that emphasize the theme's visual appeal. The repository name 'Firefox-ONE' could be subtly integrated into a digital element within the scene.

name: compose-stability-analyzer
description: ðŸ¦„ Real-time analysis of Jetpack Compose composable functions' stability directly within Android Studio or IntelliJ.
readme_summary: Compose Stability Analyzer is an IntelliJ plugin that provides real-time, visual analysis of Jetpack Compose composable function stability directly within Android Studio. It helps developers identify and fix performance issues by offering insights into why composables are stable or unstable, tracing recomposition reasons, and generating compatibility reports.
key_features: Real-time stability analysis of Jetpack Compose composables
Visual indicators (gutter icons, hover tooltips, inline hints)
Detailed reasons for composable stability or instability
Recomposition tracing with `TraceRecomposition` annotation
Export stability compatibility reports via Gradle tasks
Customizable stability indicators and analysis settings
Support for analysis in test source sets
Ignored type patterns for exclusion from analysis
primary_use_case: Improving Jetpack Compose application performance by providing developers with immediate, visual feedback on composable function stability within their IDE.
cover_image_prompt: A meticulous clockmaker in a brightly lit workshop, carefully examining the intricate gears of a complex clockwork mechanism representing a Jetpack Compose UI. Tiny, glowing icons of 'stable' (a green checkmark) and 'unstable' (a red exclamation mark) are visible on specific gears. The clockmaker uses a magnifying glass that reveals lines of code and data flow within the gears, highlighting potential performance bottlenecks. Subtle digital particles emanate from the gears, suggesting real-time analysis. The repository name 'Compose Stability Analyzer' is subtly etched onto a workbench tool. The scene is rendered in a clean, 3D isometric illustration style with a focus on clarity and detail, using a palette of blues, greens, and subtle metallic tones.

name: anyapk
description: Install any apk on the device you own.
readme_summary: anyapk is a lightweight Android application installer that bypasses developer verification requirements using local ADB connections, allowing users to install any APK file without restrictions. It aims to return control of application installation to the user, emphasizing digital autonomy and freedom from corporate or governmental gatekeepers.
key_features: One-time setup using wireless debugging
No root required
No external dependencies
System-wide integration as an APK handler
Direct file selection via built-in file picker
primary_use_case: Installing any APK file on an Android device without restrictions, bypassing developer verification requirements.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized, open Android device acting as a gateway. A user's hand is reaching through the screen, holding a generic APK file icon. This icon is transforming into a vibrant, fully formed app icon as it passes through the gateway, symbolizing unrestricted installation. Subtle digital particles and glowing lines emanate from the transformation. In the background, faint silhouettes of corporate logos and government seals are dissolving into dust, representing the bypassed gatekeepers. The overall mood is empowering and liberating. The image should be in a clean, modern 3D isometric illustration style with a bright, optimistic color palette.
